import React from 'react'; import Rack from './components/rack'; // import * as BooksAPI from './BooksAPI' import './App.css'; import SearchPage from './pages/search'; class BooksApp extends React.Component { state = { mybooklist: [ {shelf:"Read", booktitle: "To Kill a Mockingbird", bookauthors: "Harper Lee", bookurl: "http://books.google.com/books/content?id=PGR2AwAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&img=1&zoom=1&imgtk=AFLRE73-GnPVEyb7MOCxDzOYF1PTQRuf6nCss9LMNOSWBpxBrz8Pm2_mFtWMMg_Y1dx92HT7cUoQBeSWjs3oEztBVhUeDFQX6-tWlWz1-feexS0mlJPjotcwFqAg6hBYDXuK_bkyHD-y&source=gbs_api"} ], /** * TODO: Instead of using this state variable to keep track of which page * we're on, use the URL in the browser's address bar. This will ensure that * users can use the browser's back and forward buttons to navigate between * pages, as well as provide a good URL they can bookmark and share. */ shelfs: [], showSearchPage: false } render() { return (
{this.state.showSearchPage ? ( ) : (

MyReads

Currently Reading

  1. To Kill a Mockingbird
    Harper Lee
  2. Ender's Game
    Orson Scott Card

Want to Read

  1. 1776
    David McCullough
  2. Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
    J.K. Rowling
)}
) } } export default BooksApp
